metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23222 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A man-in-the-middle attacker can inject false responses to the client's first few queries, despite the use of SSL certificate verification and encryption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libecpg6 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libpq5 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-12 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-client-12 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plperl-12 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-12 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-12 - 12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. mdeslaur> Plan is for postgresql-13 to be removed from jammy, marking as deferred for now.

criterions.comment: postgresql-12 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.9-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
